item.title: 图论学习
item.description: The Basics A graph is a pair $G=(V,E)$ , $ G $ are vertics, and $E$ means edges, $E$ are 2-element subsets of $V$. A vertices $v$ is incident with an edge $e$ if $v\in e$,two vertices incident with an edge are endvertices or ends.The set of all the edges in $E$ at a vertices $v$ is denoted by $E(v)$. Some concept: graph’s order written as $|G|$, means the number
